concept.title: Processing expectations regarding the xml:lang attribute
concept.shortdesc: When the xml:lang attribute is specified as recommended, a language for the content is clearly indicated. However, when the xml:lang attribute is not specified, processors might need to assign a default value.

conbody.p: If the root element of a map or a top-level topic has no value for the xml:lang attribute, a processor SHOULD assume a default value. The default value of the processor can be either fixed, configurable, or derived from the content itself, such as the xml:lang attribute on the root map.
When a conref or conkeyref attribute is used to include content from one element into another, the processor MUST use the effective value of the xml:lang attribute from the referenced element.
Processors SHOULD render each element in a way that is appropriate for its language as identified by the xml:lang attribute.
